documentation.text: @dev YieldLever is not expected to hold any USDC

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes6) view external returns (struct Series memory)
function (bytes6,bytes6,uint8) payable external returns (bytes12,struct Vault memory)
function (uint256,address,address,string memory,bytes memory) payable external returns (bytes memory)
function (bytes12) view external returns (struct Vault memory)
function (bytes6) view external returns (struct Series memory)
function (uint256,address,address,string memory,bytes memory) payable external returns (bytes memory)
function (uint256,address,address,string memory,bytes memory) payable external returns (bytes memory)

constructor.details: YieldLever is not expected to hold any USDC

doClose(address,bytes12,uint128,uint128,.details: Calling this function outside a flash loan achieves nothing, since   the contract needs to own the vault it's getting collateral from.

params.base: - The size of the debt in USDC.
params.owner: - The address of the owner. This is the address that will be   used to obtain certain parameters, and it is also the destination for   the profit that was obtained.

doInvest(uint256,uint128,uint128,bytes12.details: Calling this function outside a flash loan achieves nothing,   since the contract needs to have assets and own the vault it's borrowing from.

params.borrowAmount: - The amount borrowed using a flash loan.
params.maxFyAmount: - The maximum amount of fyTokens to sell.
params.vaultId: - The vault id to invest in.

doRepay(address,bytes12,uint256,uint128).details: Calling this function outside a flash loan achieves nothing, since   the contract needs to own the vault it's getting collateral from.

params.owner: - The address of the owner. This is the address that will be   used to obtain certain parameters, and it is also the destination for   the profit that was obtained.

params.baseAmount: - The amount to invest from your own funds.
params.borrowAmount: - The extra amount to borrow. This is immediately   repaid, so setting this to 3 times baseAmount will incur a debt of 75%   of the collateral.
params.maxFyAmount: - The maximum amount of fyTokens to sell. Should be   enough to cover the flash loan.
params.seriesId: - The series Id to invest in. For example, 0x303230360000   for FYUSDC06LP.

returns._0: vauldId - The ID of the created vault.

params.art: - The amount of debt taken from the vault.
params.ink: - The amount of collateral in the vault. Together with art,   this value can be obtained using `cauldron.balances(vaultId);`, which   will return an object containing both `art` and `ink`.
params.maxAmount: - The maximum amount of USDC to borrow. If past   maturity, this parameter is unused as the amount can be determined   precisely.
params.pool: - The pool to deposit USDC into. This can be obtained via the   seriesId, and calling `address pool = ladle.pools(seriesId);`
params.vaultId: - The id of the vault that should be emptied.

doClose(address,bytes12,uint128,uint128,.notice: Close a vault that has already reached its expiration date.

doInvest(uint256,uint128,uint128,bytes12.notice: This function is called inside the flash loan and handles the   actual investment.

doRepay(address,bytes12,uint256,uint128).notice: Repay a vault after having borrowed a suitable amount using a   flash loan. Will only succeed if the pool hasn't reached its expiration   date yet.

invest(uint256,uint128,uint128,bytes6).notice: Invest `baseAmount` and borrow an additional `borrowAmount`.   Use this to obtain a maximum of `maxFyAmount` to repay the flash loan.   The end goal is to have a debt of `borrowAmount`, but earn interest on   the entire collateral, including the borrowed part.
